data.title: Rhebo and Paessler Integrate OT Monitoring for Plant Availability and Cybersecurity
data.meta_description: Paessler integrates Rhebo into its leading IT monitoring solution PRTG and extends cybersecurity to the Operational Technology (OT).
data.text:
Paessler integrates Rhebo into its leading IT monitoring solution PRTG

The OT and ICS monitoring with anomaly detection extends cybersecurity to the Operational Technology (OT)

System integration provides lean and cost-efficient solution via software containers

Leipzig/Nuremberg, Germany, May, 20, 2021 - Rhebo, a Landis+Gyr company, and Paessler today announced the launch of a technological integration partnership for comprehensive cybersecurity in IT and OT. As a result, Rhebo received the status of an Uptime Alliance Partner of the Paessler AG. The partnership includes the integration Rhebo’s solution for industrial control system (ICS) monitoring and anomaly detection, called Rhebo Industrial Protector, into Paessler's leading IT monitoring solution PRTG Network Monitor.

»Due to the digitalization of the industrial sector, the connection between enterprise IT and operational technology (OT) is steadily increasing,« comments Helmut Binder, CEO of Paessler, the background of the partnership. »Our PRTG Network Monitor already supports the evaluation of industrial protocols and methods such as OPC Unified Architecture (OPC UA) and Modbus, as well as the collection of asset performance and availability data. Rhebo, as an integrative service on top of our IT monitoring solution, now also creates visibility and security for the entire Industrial Control System.«

Together, Paessler and Rhebo provide an all-in-one system monitoring solution. Paessler’s PRTG monitors the entire IT environment and large parts of the OT environment. Rhebo monitors the ICS and identifies anomalies, delivers the missing information from the industrial environment, and complements the monitoring with advanced services and in-depth analyses. Rhebo Industrial Protector detects cyberattacks, manipulations, misconfigurations and also technical error states within the OT in real time.

»PRTG Network Monitor is a comprehensive tool for monitoring and optimizing cybersecurity and asset performance,« adds Rhebo CEO Klaus Mochalski. »With over 300,000 users, it has defined standards worldwide and we are very pleased about the integration of Rhebo Industrial Protector to elevate the solution even further. As a result, a large number of industrial companies benefit directly from the additional services and can efficiently strengthen their cybersecurity and plant availability.«

For more information on the integration solution of Rhebo and Paessler visit https://rhebo.com/en/download/file/loesungsprofil-paessler-integration/.

About Paessler AG

Paessler believes monitoring plays a vital part in reducing humankind’s consumption of resources. Monitoring data helps its customers save resources, from optimizing their IT, OT and IoT infrastructures to reducing energy consumption or emissions – for our future and our environment. That is why Paessler offers monitoring solutions for businesses across all industries and all sizes, from SMB to large enterprises. Paessler works with renowned partners, and together they tackle the monitoring challenges of an ever-changing world.

Since 1997, when Paessler first introduced PRTG Network Monitor, it has combined its in-depth monitoring knowledge with an innovative spirit. Paessler knows the challenges of complex IT, OT and IoT infrastructures and networks. Paessler products empower its customers to monitor everything, and thus help them optimize their resources. https://www.paessler.com/

About Rhebo

Rhebo develops and markets innovative industrial monitoring solutions and services for energy suppliers, industrial companies and critical infrastructures. The company enables its customers to guarantee both cybersecurity and the availability of their OT and IoT infrastructures and thus master the complex challenges of securing industrial networks and smart infrastructures. Since 2021, Rhebo is part of the Landis+Gyr AG, a leading global provider of integrated energy management solutions for the energy industry with around 5,000 employees in over 30 countries worldwide.

Rhebo is a partner of the Alliance for Cyber Security of the Federal Office for Information Security and is actively involved in Teletrust - IT Security Association Germany and Bitkom Working Group on Security Management for the development of security standards. https://rhebo.com/
